alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos; Reeves County Plains; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:33PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN PECOS... NORTHWESTERN BREWSTER...REEVES...EASTERN JEFF DAVIS...CENTRAL WARD... SOUTHWESTERN CRANE AND SOUTHERN LOVING COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM CDT... At 533 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northwest of Fort Stockton, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Fort Stockton, Toyah, Fort Davis, Balmorhea, Grandfalls, Barstow, Saragosa, Davis Mountains State Park, Balmorhea Lake, Balmorhea State Park, Toyah Lake, Imperial Reservoir, Star Mountain, Royalty, Toyahvale, Buffalo Trail Scout Camp, Firestone Test Track, Fort Davis National Historical Site, and Black Mountain. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 196 and 274. Interstate 20 between mile markers 15 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos; Reeves County Plains; Ward
